content.raw:
I just tested and can confirm that 2.2 is broken.

UPDATE: I added the test to branch issue_920_2.2 in 64b9e37698ec. The test currently fails.
content.html:
I just tested and can confirm that 2.2 is broken.

UPDATE: I added the test to branch issue_920_2.2 in 64b9e37698ec. The test currently fails.

content.raw:
Just tested gazebo 1.9 and 2.x and I think they might also be broken as well, please confirm.

Also done here is simplification by removing unused legacy stacked scene nodes.  The math is now much easier to follow.
content.html:
Just tested gazebo 1.9 and 2.x and I think they might also be broken as well, please confirm.

Also done here is simplification by removing unused legacy stacked scene nodes. The math is now much easier to follow.

content.raw:
If gazebo 1.9 gazebo 2.2 are unbroken, why are we making such a major change here? We should fix only the problem, and make a test.

A different pull request can be made to change the underlying functionality of the camera.
content.html:
If gazebo 1.9 gazebo 2.2 are unbroken, why are we making such a major change here? We should fix only the problem, and make a test.

A different pull request can be made to change the underlying functionality of the camera.

content.raw: Looks good, just have one comment about whether we should deprecate GetPitchNode or just remove it.
content.html: Looks good, just have one comment about whether we should deprecate GetPitchNode or just remove it.

content.raw:
Do we need to deprecate this in default? ~~We could deprecate if we backport this fix to 1.9 or 2.2, but~~ I think we could just delete it here and update the Migration guide.

EDIT: It's not a problem on 1.9 or 2.2, just default.
content.html:
Do we need to deprecate this in default? We could deprecate if we backport this fix to 1.9 or 2.2, but I think we could just delete it here and update the Migration guide.

EDIT: It's not a problem on 1.9 or 2.2, just default.

content.raw: I relaxed the bounds for camera pitch and height range, which made it possible to track object that are not near the ground plane (e.g. ufo), so the final pose is slightly different.  But visually tracking is still working.  I'll update the test but it would be great if someone else can confirm tracking is working.  Thanks.
content.html: I relaxed the bounds for camera pitch and height range, which made it possible to track object that are not near the ground plane (e.g. ufo), so the final pose is slightly different. But visually tracking is still working. I'll update the test but it would be great if someone else can confirm tracking is working. Thanks.

0.1 evaluates to 0.10000000000000001.
